description: STUDENTS DRAPED FOUR RED BANNERS OUT OF THE FOURTH FLOOR WINDOWS. MAINTENANCE SOON CUT THEM. IN RESPONSE, WE MARCHED WITH EACH 100 FOOT BANNER THROUGH THE ENTIRETY OF THE NEW BUILDING AND FOUNDATION BUILDING.

related.description: In the world of higher education, 2013 was a wild year. Thanks to the Internet and social media, students gained notoriety as the "Deranged Sorority Girl" and the "Drunkest College Student Ever," and professors learned that fat-shaming tweets could affect their employment prospects.
related.title: Meet The People Who Made The Biggest Impact In Higher Ed This Year

related.description: It's my fault. I'll admit it. During my eight years in the classroom, I ruined at least two amazing literary works by assigning horrifically dull reading projects. My only hope is that those middle school students, whose enthusiasm I quashed, found another way to become passionate about literature.
related.title: Projects to Engage Middle School Readers

related.description: A number of education trends made their mark in 2013, from massive open online courses to evaluating colleges based on their graduation rates. The underlying forces that drove change this year aren't likely to change anytime soon: declining public funding, changing demographics, advancing technology, and a tough job market.
related.title: 5 Higher-Education Trends for 2014

title: COOPER UNION WALK OUT/WORK OUT, PROTEST, OWS STUDENT DEBT $1T MARCH, NYPD AT COOPER
content:
STUDENTS DRAPED FOUR RED BANNERS OUT OF THE FOURTH FLOOR WINDOWS. MAINTENANCE SOON CUT THEM. IN RESPONSE, WE MARCHED WITH EACH 100 FOOT BANNER THROUGH THE ENTIRETY OF THE NEW BUILDING AND FOUNDATION BUILDING.

THE FIRST TIME JESSE WAS ON THE STATUE THERE WAS NOT A SEMBLANCE OF COMMOTION

PRESIDENT Jamshed Bharucha & Board of Trustee MARK EPSTEIN PLAY

JAMSHED'S SIGNATURE ON CU MISSION STATEMENT

CU STUDENTS AGAINST STUDENT DEBT MARCHED TO MEET OWS $1T STUDENT DEBT MARCH

THE OWS MARCH WENT SOUTH AND STOPPED IN FRONT OF THE COOPER UNION. JESSE KREUZER THEN CLIMBED THE PETER COOPER STATUE TO ADDRESS THE MARCH OF WHAT HAD TO BE TWO - THREE HUNDRED ON COOPER UNION'S CURRENT FINANCIAL CRISIS AND ITS DIRECT PARALLEL TO THE SYSTEMIC PROBLEM OF STUDENT DEBT/FOR PROFIT EDUCATIONAL MODELS ALL OVER THE WORLD. BEING ON THE TOP OF THE STATUE DREW MORE THAN 70 POLICE MEN, EMERGENCY VEHICLES, AND HELICOPTERS FOR WHAT WAS AT LEAST A TWO HOUR STANDOFF. SARAH ABRUNA WAS ALSO ARRESTED FOR WHAT SEEMED TO BE SIMPLY BEING IN THE WRONG PLACE AT THE WRONG TIME. SHE WAS LEAVING THE SCHOOL BUILDING IN THE MIDST OF THE PROTEST AND I BELIEVE THE POLICE SAW IT AS AN OPPORTUNITY TO MAKE AN EXAMPLE OF AN INNOCENT, LAW-ABIDING BYSTANDER.

STUDENTS GATHERED ON THE BALCONY ON THE THIRD FLOOR BUT MAINTENANCE WAS TOLD BY THE NYPD TO KICK US OFF THE PORCH BECAUSE OUR CHANTS WERE PROVOKING JESSE (WE WERE INSIDE THE SCHOOL BUT STILL UNDER DIRECTION OF THE NYPD). WE MOVED TO THE FOURTH FLOOR AND BEGAN TO YELL OUT OF THE WINDOWS AND THE SAME THING HAPPENED. WE THEN MOVED TO THE FIFTH FLOOR WITH A MIC AND AMPLIFIER AND CHANTED TILL MAINTENANCE STOPPED US ONCE AGAIN.

SOMEONE TOLD ME THEY COUNTED 68 POLICE OFFICERS AND THERE WERE EVEN HELICOPTERS ABOVE. NEWS OR POLICE? UNSURE.

SOON AFTER BEING KICKED OUT OF THE FIFTH FLOOR, WE GATHERED OUTSIDE ON THE HANDICAP RAMP WHERE WE WERE NOT PREVIOUSLY ALLOWED AND CHANTED ON STUDENT DEBT AND ON COOPER UNION'S STATE OF AFFAIRS.

entities.name: Jamshed Bharucha & Board of Trustee MARK EPSTEIN
